content: Search for: EEE-Industry Supported Laboratories NSRIT > Electrical & Electronics Engineering > EEE-Industry Supported Laboratories Department Profile About the Department CSE-Magazines Faculty Faculty List Faculty Participations & Achievements Student’s Corner Roll of Honour Academic Toppers Academic Projects Skill Oriented Courses Professional Societies – Activities Co-Curricular Activities Technical Club Extra Curricular Activities Placements Laboratories Program Specific Lab Details Industry Supported Laboratories Department Administration Research Publications Projects & Consultancy CSE-Startups Industrial Intraction Department MOUs CSE Internships Industrial Visits Learning Resources CSE-Materials CSE-Self Reflection Videos CSE-Alumni Department Gallery Contact Us Industry Supported Laboratories S.No Lab Name Configuration Utilization 1 Centre for EV Technology & Industry 4.0 EV components and 3D Printing machine All Final year students are utilizing for their mini project & major project implementations and used for preparing project documents. EV Components: Allows experimentation with energy conversion from battery systems to mechanical systems, focusing on electric vehicle technologies. 3D Printing Machine: Enables students to fabricate custom components for prototyping and product development using digital designs. ×
